topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555609436368724dd3e80c00#post_555609436368724dd3e80c00
That's cause western culture is based off of Abrahamic faiths dude and drastically are different from other cultures.  The fallacy you present is that you're thinking of culture as a monolithic singularity.


To use an analogy in the usa waving your hand at people is considered a kind gesture; in other parts of the world you'd get punched in the face for giving them the equivalent of the finger.

Oh my god dude; you have to get into history classes.  I may sound like a huge nerd here, but it's incredibly interesting how we went from cavemen to modern era and how all these cultural things wound up being created and how religion formed modern culture.

A prime example of what I mean by this is that for muslims drawing muhammad is incredibly offensive, but the majority of people in the world just outright don't get why it's offensive.

topics.body: You know what I miss? Printed publications of Shonen Jump. I used to get those all the time until VIZ cancelled the service. Now that's not to say Shonen Jump Alpha is bad, it's anything but. I just  love the feeling of holding something in my hands. Feeling the pages turn. Smelling the ink. I guess I'm the sentimental type...
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55560dc66368720e608a3800#post_55560dc66368720e608a3800
Dude; again you're thinking that cultures are monoliths.  The reason why a lot of cultures are to some level similar is because of cultures bleeding into each other and cultural evolution.


An example of what I mean by is that the reason why cannibalism is only practiced by a couple cultures is that you can get diseases from it so of course cannibalism is looked down by the majority of the world.

To put it another way: think of cultures as like a bunch of monkeys judging whether or not they can make a jump; all the dumb ones that misjudge it go splat.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55560fcc63687226e1db2200#post_55560fcc63687226e1db2200
The thing is though that you're thinking that cultures are monoliths.

To point out the fallacy as succinct as humanly possible:
You believe that there's different cultures in the world correct?  For example the usa culturally is drastically from say Myanmar right?  By admitting that different places in the world can have drastically different cultures you're admitting that cultural taboos don't translate.

To make it even more succinct think of the word n****r; in other countries they just straight up don't understand why in the usa it's offensive or what it even means.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5556120463687226e1cd2500#post_5556120463687226e1cd2500
The problem is that slur words don't translate well and that cultural origins of slur words don't translate well.  In order for every culture to understand why every slur word is offensive would require every person to speak the same language and be taught history lessons into every country.


The reason why Japan constantly laughs at the usa is because of the language barrier making us all look like idiots.

Think of cultures as like a animal species; each individual animal of the species represents a individual culture.  Cultural change is evolution; the species can evolve through both evolutionary pressure forcing elements of the species unable to change into death whereas surviving elements reproduce and are able to weather the new paradigm.

topics.body:
A little spot of info: 

Kaspersky has found a group of cyberspies, calling themselves Naikon, stealing geopolitical information on the islands in and around South China Sea. Here's the dig- they speak Mandarin. Their operations has been monitored for at least 5 years. Only way for a group like that to last 5 years is if they had state backing.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555614826368722f1d700f00#post_555614826368722f1d700f00
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555613016368724dd33b1900#post_555613016368724dd33b1900
this is pointless, you are acting like those morons who take Schrodinger cat seriously[/bq]
Dude; Schrodinger's cat paradox was a thought experiment for the Heisenberg's uncertainty principle about quantum uncertainty.  Don't talk about quantum physics cause I will legitimately rekt you.

"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555614826368722f1d700f00#post_555614826368722f1d700f00
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/555613016368724dd33b1900#post_555613016368724dd33b1900
you are over complicating the simple act of people saying "that's not cool it's like me doing this" which yeah you can do,[/bq]
You're oversimplifying science is the problem.  There's tons and tons and tons of science about human culture about why things to one culture are offensive whereas to another they don't see the problem why.

My point: to use an analogy the problem with your argument style is that you're oversimplifying *science*.  To use a further analogy you're like the people that go "well if we need a magnet strong enough to warp space for faster than light travel why don't we just build one?" and whenever I go, "because we can't realistically control it and if we were to do so chances are we would create a subspace bubble that the crew can't escape and even if we don't kill the crew the energy shockwave from the from of the warp when slowing down would essentially shotgun a planet with pure energy thus killing all life on the planet and destroying it" you go "you're over-complicating it; it's not rocket science".

Sociology may be a soft science, but it's still a science.

Tl:dr; Don't use the "it's not rocket science" logical argument for a science.
